summary: The economic disruption from COVID-19 prompted concerns about the solvency of defense contractors and their suppliers. The Department of Defense normally finances some contractors' work on complex weapon systems through monthly "progress payments," e.g., paying 80% of invoiced expenses. To address emerging concerns, DOD increased its payment rates. DOD expected contractors would use some of the funds to shore up their subcontractors and suppliers, but...
title: Defense Contracting: More Insight into Use of Financing Payments Could Benefit DOD in Future Emergencies
